channel.title: North Texas Homebrew Circuit
channel.description: Recent content on North Texas Homebrew Circuit

item.title: North Texas Homebrew Circuit
item.description:
The North Texas Homebrew Circuit is homebrew competition circuit promoting and assisting the local North Texas Homebrew Clubs with their Homebrew Competitions.

Competitions for 2025:

  • March Madness Beer Bracket Challenge hosted by Horsemen of the Hopocalypse Opens 3-3-25 live judging 4-12-25

  • Spirit of '76 - hosted by Horsemen of the Hopocalypse Opens 4-28-25 closes 5-9-25 Awards July 12th

  • Oâ€™Zapft Is - hosted by Cap and Hare Opens 8-2-25 closes 8-16-25 Awards September 30th

item.title: Prose
item.description:
@tailwindcss/typography

View on GitHub!

Beautiful typographic defaults for HTML you don’t control.

The official Tailwind CSS Typography plugin provides a set of prose classes you can use to add beautiful typographic defaults to any vanilla HTML you donâ€™t control, like HTML rendered from Markdown, or pulled from a CMS.

Tailwind CSS IntelliSense extension for Visual Studio Code

<article class="prose lg:prose-xl">
  {{ markdown }}
</article>

To see what it looks like in action, check out our live demo on Tailwind Play. â€‹

item.title: Spirit of '76
item.description:
The Spirit of â€˜76 Homebrew Competition is a sanctioned by the American Homebrewers Association (AHA) and the Beer Judge Certification Program (BJCP). This contest is open to all amateur homebrewers age 21 and older and is restricted to non-commercial, homebrewed beers. Beer produced on the premises of commercial breweries, including brew-on-premises establishments, are not eligible.

The competition goal is to celebrate American Style Beers. One may only each sub-category once. The competition will be limited to the first 300 total paid entries. Each Participant will be limited to 8 entries.

item.title: Texas Red Coat Challenge
item.description: Competition Site The Texas Redcoat Challenge is a specialty homebrew competition focused on British beer styles and sponsored by the Denton County Homebrewers Guild. The Texas Redcoat Challenge is unique in that the BJCP styles of beers recognized as “British” in origin or inspiration are the focus, rather than just being grouped as part of the overall field of competition. We want to bring these beers back to the forefront and showcase the original American brewing tradition, helping to shine a light on these fantastic beers, the history behind them, and the brewers crafting them.
